title: Spectators run for their lives after rampaging bull leaps over fence
text:
This is the moment a bull leapt over a fence at a bull running event into stands of screaming onlookers - leaving four people injured.

Spectators struggle to bring the enraged animal under control as it ran through a small gap between the arena fence and seats, sending dozens of people flying.

The incident took place during one of the 'encierro' bull-running events of the local parties in the town of Cortes, in the northern Spanish region of Navarre.

In the video, a bull can be seen running around the bullring full of spectators when it suddenly leaps over the protective fence and into the stands.

Onlookers can be heard screaming and some spectators help pull those stuck near the fence to safety.

The bull can be seen running around the outside of the fence and then back into the bull ring, where a man with a red cape tries to distract it.

The bull runs towards the man who sprints to safety before the bovine leaps the protective fence again as another bull runs into the ring.

In the video, a bull can be seen running around the bullring full of spectators when it suddenly leaps over the protective fence and into the stands. One person is seen flying backwards after the bull gets a hold of him

The bull again jumps over a fence as spectator rush for higher ground. Another bull is somehow released into the arena at the same time

Both bulls then end up in the ring and another video shows how the bull had charged into the stands of onlookers after leaping the fence.

Reports state a woman from Bunuel, Navarre, and a 74-year-old man from Mallen, Zaragoza, were injured along with two others who have not been identified in reports.

The elderly man had to be taken to hospital in a very serious condition and underwent urgent surgery.

The organisers reportedly decided to remove the bull from the ring and the event was cancelled in order to help paramedics attend to the injured.
description: Hundreds of spectators attending a bull-running event in Cortes, northern Spain were forced to scramble out of the way as a large bull leapt into the stands and injured four people.
